sp: 1.1.1 State the quantity by comparing.
1.2.1 Name the numbers up to 100 : (i) count objects in groups. (ii) name the number for a group of objects to represent its quantity. (iii) compare quantity of two groups of objects.

1.2.2 Determine the number values up to 100 : (i) show the quantity of the given number. (ii) match group of objects with its number. (iii) compare the value of two numbers. (iv) arrange group of objects in ascending and descending order.
1.3.1 Write numbers in numerals and words
1.4.1 State combinations of one digit numbers.
1.5.1 Count numbers.
1.5.2 Complete any number sequence.
1.6.1 State the place value and digit value of any number.
1.7.1 Give reasonable estimation for the quantiy of objects.
1.8.1 Round off whole numbers to the nearest ten.
1.9.1 Identify pattern for a given number
1.9.2 Complete various simple number patterns.
1.10.1 Solve problems involving daily situations.
objektif: By the end of the lesson, pupils will be able to State the quantity by comparing. correctly.
By the end of the lesson, pupils will be able to State the quantity by comparing. with guidance.

aktiviti.text: A simple 'Pop Quiz' to recall previous knowledge.
Teacher introduces new vocabulary using picture cards.
Pupils work in groups for a 'Gallery Walk' activity.
Remedial exercises for pupils who need guidance.
Singing the goodbye song.

sp: 2.1.1 Use and vary the relevant vocabulary in context of addition and subtraction.
2.1.2 Introduce the symbol of addition, subtraction and ’equal to’.
2.1.3 Use the symbol of addition, subtraction and ’equal to’, to write number sentence based on the given situation.
2.2.1 Add in the range of basic facts.
2.2.2 Add two numbers with the sum within 100.
2.3.1 Subtract in the range of basic facts.
2.3.2 Subtract two numbers within 100.
2.4.1 Create stories involving addition and subtraction within 100.
2.4.2 Solve problems involving addition and subtraction in daily life situations.
2.5.1 Write number sentence of repeated addition in twos, fives, tens and fours.
2.6.1 Write number sentence of repeated subtraction in twos, fives, tens and fours.
objektif: By the end of the lesson, pupils will be able to Use and vary the relevant vocabulary in context of addition and subtraction. correctly.
By the end of the lesson, pupils will be able to Use and vary the relevant vocabulary in context of addition and subtraction. with guidance.

aktiviti.text: Teacher displays flashcards to stimulate interest.
Teacher introduces new vocabulary using picture cards.
Role-play activity based on the given situation.
Pupils construct sentences using the new vocabulary.
Singing the goodbye song.

sk: 3.1 Concept of one over two and one over four in proper fractions.
sp: 3.1.1 Identify one over two, one over four, two over four and three over four.
3.2.1 Solve problems involving daily life situations.
objektif: By the end of the lesson, pupils will be able to Identify one over two, one over four, two over four and three over four. correctly.
By the end of the lesson, pupils will be able to Identify one over two, one over four, two over four and three over four. with guidance.

aktiviti.text: Teacher shows a short video clip related to the topic.
Teacher introduces new vocabulary using picture cards.
Group activity: 'Round Table' brainstorming session.
Pupils complete the comprehension worksheet individually.
Singing the goodbye song.

sp: 4.1.1 Identify coins and notes of Malaysian currency.
4.1.2 Represent the value of money in : (i) Sen up to RM1. (ii) Ringgit up to RM10.
4.1.3 Convert money in : (i) Coins up to RM1. (ii) Notes up to RM10.
4.2.1 Identify financial resources and savings.
4.2.2 Record savings and expenses from the financial resources.
4.3.1 Solve daily life problems involving addition and subtraction of money.
objektif: By the end of the lesson, pupils will be able to Identify coins and notes of Malaysian currency. correctly.
By the end of the lesson, pupils will be able to Identify coins and notes of Malaysian currency. with guidance.

aktiviti.text: Pupils sing an action song related to the theme.
Pupils read the text aloud with correct pronunciation.
Pupils practice dialogue in pairs (Think-Pair-Share).
Teacher conducts a quick quiz to check understanding.
Teacher summarizes the lesson key points.

sp: 5.1.1 State time in a day.
5.1.2 State the sequence of events in a day.
5.1.3 Name the days of a week.
5.1.4 Name the months of a year.
5.2.1 Identify the clock hands on the clock face.
5.2.2 Identify and state ”half”, ”quarter” and ”three quarters” based on the clock face.
5.2.3 Say and write time in hour, half an hour and a quarter hour using an analogue clock.
5.3.1 Solve problems involving daily life situations.
objektif: By the end of the lesson, pupils will be able to State time in a day. correctly.
By the end of the lesson, pupils will be able to State time in a day. with guidance.

aktiviti.text: Teacher displays flashcards to stimulate interest.
Teacher explains the main concept using a mind map on the board.
Pupils practice dialogue in pairs (Think-Pair-Share).
Remedial exercises for pupils who need guidance.
Pupils complete an 'Exit Ticket'.

sk: 6.1 Relative units to measure length, mass and volume of liquids.
sp: 6.1.1 Use and vary the vocabulary in the context of length, mass and volume of liquid..
6.1.2 Measure length and mass of objects, and volume of liquid using non-standard units.
6.1.3 Compare the length, mass, and volume of liquid of two or more objects using non-standard units.
6.2.1 Solve problems involving daily life situations.
objektif: By the end of the lesson, pupils will be able to Use and vary the vocabulary in the context of length, mass and volume of liquid.. correctly.
By the end of the lesson, pupils will be able to Use and vary the vocabulary in the context of length, mass and volume of liquid.. with guidance.

sp: 1.1.1 State the quantity by comparing.
1.2.1 Name the numbers up to 100 : (i) count objects in groups. (ii) name the number for a group of objects to represent its quantity. (iii) compare quantity of two groups of objects.

1.2.2 Determine the number values up to 100 : (i) show the quantity of the given number. (ii) match group of objects with its number. (iii) compare the value of two numbers. (iv) arrange group of objects in ascending and descending order.
1.3.1 Write numbers in numerals and words
1.4.1 State combinations of one digit numbers.
1.5.1 Count numbers.
1.5.2 Complete any number sequence.
1.6.1 State the place value and digit value of any number.
1.7.1 Give reasonable estimation for the quantiy of objects.
1.8.1 Round off whole numbers to the nearest ten.
1.9.1 Identify pattern for a given number
1.9.2 Complete various simple number patterns.
1.10.1 Solve problems involving daily situations.
objektif: By the end of the lesson, pupils will be able to State the quantity by comparing. correctly.
By the end of the lesson, pupils will be able to State the quantity by comparing. with guidance.
